turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: So what happened to the barbecues, and fishing?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Watch my lips, coz you're not gonna believe this - <u>this</u> is a rare occurrence. We haven't had a body in eighteen months.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What about that kid, Ross?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Oh, shit. Of course. The kid.  <u>Travis</u>. Find that kid and get the knife off him. He's gonna lie to you - but he's got it - so <u>get</u> it. Well, go on, get on with it. Whatta you staring at?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I think you're here all day.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: We give it one more hour. Did the photographer do the dogs?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: The <u>dogs</u>?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Two dogs. He should do the dogs.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Yeah, he can go ...

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Think I'll lay down with him. Only way I'll get outta here.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Who is who?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: A professional, whining, con-person bitch with an ass the size of Africa ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Not for me ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What d'you mean, I just opened it for you? This is <u>French</u> champagne.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Not today .. I'm on a diet to- day .. I'll take a diet soda ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Since when did you drink diet soda?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: How's the new residence?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: O.K.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Not too good in daylight ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: C'mon, just shut your eyes until it's painted.  You're gonna love it. This is "God's Country," John.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What time is it?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Seven thirty-five .. Here, "Town Gets Top Cop." I was gonna pin it to your wall.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Why so coy about the word "frozen"?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Because, don't get into it ...

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: There's nothing in the files?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Watch my lips .. <u>Don't get into it</u> ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: It's an "unsolved." They spent 500 thousand dollars & bought emselves a dead end - You might wanna check it with Taylor, he worked the case.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I already did. What's his problem?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: He thinks you stole his promotion.  What exactly you doin there, John?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: It's a method for quitting smoking.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: It's a technique I read about. If you smoke 60 a day, you buy three packs, throw one cigar- ette away, and smoke 59. Day 2, you throw 2 away and smoke 58 ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Why don't you throw them all away, and smoke none?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Because it's a ritual you gotta go through with. I'm down to 10.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You want my advice?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Maybe?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Find yourself a farmer's daughter with nice big fucking tits, and shake that "bye-bye." Send it to Sacramento, John .. I sniff grief ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You gotta stop smoking ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I <u>am</u> stopping smoking ...

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I don't mean this "system" shit that keeps you sucking, I mean <u>stop</u> .. I was exactly like you are .. I used to wake in the night - heart going so hard I coulda made love with my left tit .. If I can stop, <u>you</u> can ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: How'd you do it, old man?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Someone bet me a dollar ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: A dollar? .. Not worth giving up for a dollar ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Worrying - clicking - picking - You may as well be back in Los Angeles.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What do you mean, Ross?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Why don't you dump it? Mail it off. Give the fucking F.B.I. a present?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Why don't you dump the "Fat Lady?"

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Because I dislike her too much ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: O.K. and I'm not in love with this fukker? That's how I feel about him.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: No you don't. That's how you <u>think</u> you feel about him. That's how you feel about <u>yourself</u>. You won't give yourself one-fucking-minute for <u>you</u>.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Pig Woman agreed to take a test.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I think I got something - twenty two years old, dark hair - study- ing mathematics -  - Last seen <u>5 weeks ago</u> ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Where is everyone?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I dunno .. I guess this is staff side of the building?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: This looks promising .. I think this one could be it?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Thank Christ we got a witness.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Let me just keep going a while. She might remember something?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: <u>What</u>? She's <u>blind</u>, Bro. You may as well ask one of these Beethoven guys on the piano?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Had a seeing Eye Dog since she was eighteen .. didn't I tell you those dogs meant something ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: No, you didn't.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Alright, I didn't, but I nearly did, and if I had I'd have been right .. I knew there was some- thing about that Labrador, that dog was too good to be dead .. We gotta get back up that dump ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: No way .. not me, Mister. I'm not going up there again. Might find someone's prick in a hot-dog roll.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: We're going.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Forget it. They got stringent hyg- iene rules. He's long gone in lime.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Maybe not? I'm feeling lucky ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: So am I. But where's my money?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Don't start again. If you win a bet, you can't keep winning it ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Pay me, and I shut up.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I haven't got it.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Then give me that Zippo.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I need some security. I don't trust you anymore.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I had one <u>puff</u> on a <u>pipe</u>.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I don't want excuses, I want that weird-looking stuff called "cash."

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What do you want it for?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: To throw out of the window.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What are you doing, Ross? I've had that 15 years! ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: It's not your friend. It keeps you sucking. Remem- ber the old Bum's lungs?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I remember the old bastard's liver! I don't believe you did that. I had a great sent- imental attachment to that.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You want me to stop the car?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Six girls over a period of 18 months, and give or take a head or two, the M.O.'s exactly the same. Dark hair. No hands. All shot with a high velocity twen- ty-two in the back of the head.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: How come the F.B.I. don't put anya this together? They work- ed over "Jennifer" for months?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: They possibly did - but they nev- er had a head, so they never had a bullet - and they never got an I.D. - not on any of em - never bust a homicide unless you know who your victim is - we're the first to get a positive identity.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Identity of whom? You got a girl, doesn't even have a driver's lic- ense? .. She's untraceable, John .. You need fifty detectives on this.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: That's what I'm here for. I want you to come and see Citrine with me?  He's not gonna here it from me but I know he'd listen to you.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Listen to me saying what?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I wanna take that fucking Blind In- stitute to pieces .. Every address book, every phone call, everyone in and outta there in the last 5 years ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: For a <u>dead</u> <u>dog</u>?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: We've fused into a major series, Ross. This girl isn't the second victim. This is "Jennifer <u>Eight</u>."

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: That isn't what you said before.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I was wrong.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You believe me, don't you?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What does it matter what I bel- ieve? .. What you gotta worry about is what Citrine believes ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Did he shut you down?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: All but .. How <u>you</u> doing?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I dunno, I daren't go in there - just about get her wired up, and the fucking mayor walks in - mad as hell - what are we doing fuck- ing with his staff? We should be out chasing major violators ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I wish he'd tell that to Citrine.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Did I say he did?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You looked like you did?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: No, I think you'll find I looked like he could have? By accident even? He's up here spraying the scenery all day.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: He didn't shoot it, Ross. And no way by accident. There's a flash-burn. It was point-blank.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Why's she blind, Bro?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Car accident.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: God, it pisses me off, Ross.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: No God, Brother. If there was a God, asses wouldn't be at the perfect height for kicking.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Stop it.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I never knew about the sailor the- ory, Ross. He might have that one little thing I need in his files?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: John, <u>stop</u> <u>it</u>. The case is on its ass, you're closed.  C'mon, let it go for once .. Have a drink. C'mon, relax, drink your beer ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You gotta stop calling Los Angeles .. You're dragging L.A. around with you like an addiction.  Look at the shit you're putting yourself through? For what? For <u>nothing</u>, I know it, I been there. Remember me? Up to my asshole in anger, living off the vitamins in cigarettes?  If there's a body under the snow, <u>fuck</u> <u>it</u>. Let somebody else worry about it. You gotta accept you stopped living in that world, & try and give yourself a break in this ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Just makes to so God damned mad ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You're a fucking great policeman, but give yourself a break. You're here 5 minutes, you find yourself a fucking homicide? .. Not many people could do that in a place like this .. And you gotta admit, there's a lot of shaky areas in this case? .. I mean, stop me if I'm going up the wrong nostril ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: She wasn't lying about the van.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Alright, she wasn't lying about the van. But it could have been <u>any</u> van? Any little foreign diesel? .. She's <u>blind</u>, Bro .. It's sad .. She's pro- bably lonely, and you're a nice guy to have around .. But you're getting far too far into the element, Brother ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You don't need me to tell you what hap- pens when you get emotionally involved?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Alright, enough, Ross. You'll bring on my "Nervous Tick" ...

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Nothing you gotta say do I wanna hear right now. So save yourself saying it.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I'm not in here to apologize, John. I told you what was gonna happen & it's happened? "Good-bye, Princess," & the same night she gets attacked? That's a tough one to swallow, Bro?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I'm already familiar with Taylor's opinion.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You don't really believe this?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: <u>One hundred fucking per cent</u>! .. And you know why? Coz I never told her good-bye. O.K.? Is that good enough for the "committee?"

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Well .. I didn't know that ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No .. You didn't know that ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: That's a very stupid question, Ross.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I'm asking it.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: How the hell do I know <u>who</u>? Some jerk-off. Some peeping-tom prick.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Ease off, John ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: <u>I'm sick of this toy town shit</u>.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Everything you say sounds reason- able. But there's also a reason- able explanation for the opposite.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Don't give me that! <u>Not another</u> <u>word</u>! When you had the Fat Lady in there, and I asked you if she was lying, you looked me right in the eyes and said <u>yes</u>. So as far as I was concerned, <u>she's ly-</u> <u>ing</u>. And if the King of fucking England had walked in & told me different, I wouldn't have bel- ieved him - because <u>you</u> told me ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I dunno what I can do to help you?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I dunno what I'd do with your help. I've gotta take her out of there ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What about Citrine?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Screw Citrine. He can fire me.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Can't thank you enough, Ross ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Don't thank me. Thank Margie.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Yeah .. I guess she's in the kit- chen .. We got a so-called prof- essional cook out there having a nervous breakdown over a turkey ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Are you sure you didn't call?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You got a quiet phone somewhere?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Hey, John, don't start getting antsy over this tonight. It may well have been the local cops?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: That's just what I wanna find out.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Jesus. What are you doin?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: I spose I'm drinking myself to sleep. It's Helena's Christmas songs .. they're really pretty ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What exactly you doing, John?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I'm going up to the institute.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Now?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: This "cop" that's calling, thinks she gonna be there over Christmas.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Listen, you don't havta come?

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Hey ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Where's your watch?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I guess by the bed.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: It's twenty of three.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Bull shit .. I'm in my prime ..

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Bits.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What d'you mean, "bits."

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: Policemen's bodies age at diff- erent rates. Look at me. Gut in its fifties. Balls in their six- ties. And feet in their eighties ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: <u>Hit those wipers, Ross</u>.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: What if we need a back up?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: We're not <u>here</u>. I don't want the desk to hear us ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Alright. I'll start at the top, and work down.

turns.speaker: ROSS
turns.text: You ain't going in alone?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: That's a liability, Ross. I don't want you hanging on to my shirt. Anyone but me comes down these stairs, take em out but try and keep him alive. I want this bastard living ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Why did he ask if it was frozen?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: That, I couldn't tell you .. And don't worry about anya this crap, by the time you're back it's gone ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: What is that?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Laser enhancement of the finger- tip .. it's really bothering me .. See these striations right here?  It's like she's always worrying the end of her finger? Rubbing it with a thumb nail, or something?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: How do you know her hair's black?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Hair on her hand. Plus Jen- nifer had raven black hair.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: What is all this Jennifer stuff?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Yes, Sir, I think they maybe. I think "Jennifer," and this lady got hit by the same guy?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: I don't see that at all ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I got four points of posit- ive comparison on the cut ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Yeah, that's all very inter- esting, but where's the body?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Probably making him feel a bit antsy seein it back on the wall. He worked a lotta time on this.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I thought it was Taylor's case?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Sucked in officers from all over the county. And it was the worst six months this station ever had.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What do you want me to do, Chief?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: I'm not telling you what to do. What I will say, is <u>right</u> <u>now</u>, that child's tricycle there is more important to me than this ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: You're pushing this too hard. It's like you <u>want</u> me to say <u>stop</u>? You must know that's the way this is going, John? There's other work to do, why don't ya ease off a little?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Coz this is a major & we're closer to this bastard than anyone's ever been.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Then <u>where's the body</u>? .. Where's the body, and <u>why's he hidden it</u>?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: He <u>hasn't</u> hidden it. He never made a hit this far north before, and he never read a weather forecast .. She's probably fifteen feet from the highway, three feet under snow.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Have you got a match on the bullet?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Have you got a print from the hand?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No, Sir.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: It could be anyone's hand. Illeg- ally disposed of hospital debris ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: It's <u>her</u> hand. <u>Her</u> scars. <u>Her</u> dog. Her dog's shot. And she's missing.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: She's <u>not</u> "missing." Did she shout? Did she scream? Did he coerce her? <u>No</u>. She left of her own free will .. And if she gets on a plane and goes to Peru with the prick, she's still not missing. You got no case, John.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: If you're not gonna hear me, Chief ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: I <u>have</u> heard you. You just don't like hearing <u>me</u>. You got this whole damned thing outta proportion. I don't know what you gotten used to in Los Angeles, but I don't believe there's a Police Chief, <u>in this country</u>, would put a task force together for a body part ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: We have a multiple homicide, Sir ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: We have a body part in suspicious circumstances - a tailor's dummy wearing a brassiere - <u>and a bill</u> <u>for seventeen dollars for its wig</u>!

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: I'm shutting you down on this "blind thing," John.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Is that my punishment for embarrassing Mr Heineman?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Don't underestimate me .. the Mayor's pissed - but that's nothing to do with this - sit down - How many times have you been up at that institute?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Three or four.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: I'm talking, outside the girl?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Once.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Got a letter from this Goodridge guy? Says, you're upsetting his students?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: That's bullshit,

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: He says, you freaked one of em out?  "Asking a newly blind kid if he can 'see,' is both cruel, and dangerous" ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I never asked if he could "see." I just asked one or two of the stud- ents if they remembered anything?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: And did they?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Alright, you got it. And I'll be putting an Observer in with you.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I want Serato ..  Why can't I have Serato?

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: Coz I'm <u>short of men</u> & Ang- elo won't do it .. Who ever I got free first - <u>you</u> <u>get</u> ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I'll sign anything you want. <u>Please</u>. Bring here her .. <u>I want Helena here</u> ..

turns.speaker: CITRINE
turns.text: You ain't talking to no one, till you calm down.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I am calm .. <u>I am calm</u> ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Week or two.  Musta been on the ker- osene.  Stinks like a diesel engine.

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Fucken noddle's hanging off ..

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: What does that mean, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Cut your own throat, you're ner- vous about it, tend to hesitate. He's got three trial cuts, lower left side of the neck, before he works up courage for the big one.

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Alright, gentlemen, I'm gonna leave you. I got a couple of questions for the paper, Serg- eant? Mind if I swing by later, wring out a tea-bag with you?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: My pleasure .. Who's Popeye?

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Your predecessor. He did- n't like to get outta bed. Catch you later, Freddy T ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Is this normal?

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Average rainfall, 48 inches. Pisses down, October to June.

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Did he get you the job?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I think he would have if he could have - been trying to get me up here long enough - I think he may have bribed the old guy to retire ..

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Popeye wasn't old. Younger than you.

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Did you find the knife, Sergeant?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No .. But we have a theory ..

turns.speaker: BLATTIS
turns.text: Kid told me he didn't take it?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Maybe he's lying to you?

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Yeah, in and outta Frisco on the big boats .. Every lead we had went right out to sea .. Night, night, Freddy T .. John ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: How come he's suddenly so forth- coming? I'd like to kick him right in the ass. If he'd discussed it with me, I mighta gotten somewhere ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: .. feel like I'm getting close to this guy .. and all the time, feel like I'm sharpening a pencil with a broken load .. I'm sorry, King J ..

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: What are you looking for?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Vehicle references.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Wrong cabinet.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: His blind friend got "attacked." Angelo went up there, and some- how, it got itself in the paper.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: <u>You</u> put it in there.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I may have said some- thing. I don't recall.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Don't lie, Taylor. I just had this Blattis guy on the phone asking me for a comment - you gave him the whole damned case!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Alright, I gave him the case? .. So the case is closed, so what?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: So read it! You just hung a target around her neck!

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Don't you know nothing about this guy? He <u>reads</u> the newspapers. Col- lects the cuttings. When are they gonna find her? Now he's reading Helena Robertson's name, phrased like she's a fucking witness. You couldn't have done anything more stupid if you'd sat down & tried ..

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Hey, c'mon, country boys, let's all line up and hear the expert.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Just walk away from me, Taylor ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You don't know what you done, Taylor.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: <u>If</u>, your friend from San Diego was up here, and thought for <u>one</u> out of <u>two fucken seconds</u>, she was a danger to him, he'da taken her out weeks ago ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I know what a "witness" is.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: Well, her, it ain't. That bitch is blind as a blonde fucken bat.

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: He's offerin you a deal? Why don't you take it ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: He ain't offerin me shit.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I've told you the truth. It isn't me .. I've never call- ed Ross "Freddy" in my life ..

turns.speaker: TAYLOR
turns.text: I've heard you call him Freddy.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You <u>haven't</u>. And you got no voice in here, Taylor, <u>so keep it shut</u>.

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: As recent as we have .. What ex- actly is your interest in Amber?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I'm afraid I can't give you an ans- wer to that, Mr Goodridge. As I ex- plained to your secretary, we're do- ing a lotta looking, but we're not even sure it's her we're lookin for ..

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: Then what are you hoping I'm gon- na do? Dissuade, or persuade you?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I was hopin since we spoke that you might have remembered something that would give us an idea where she is?

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: Then you could have saved yourself a lot of driving, Sergeant. What I said on the phone's the same as I'm saying now. I got no idea where Amb- er is, or who it was took her there.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Yes, Sir.

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: As she's a member of my staff, may I ask what this is about?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Well, apparently, she saw Amber the weekend she left, & was briefly in the room with the guy she left with.

turns.speaker: GOODRIDGE
turns.text: I see .. Well, she's teaching an- other class at four .. I'd apprec- iate it if you don't detain her ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: What d'you wanna ask, Mr Ross?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I'm Mr Berlin.  Mr Ross is right here. And Mr Ross is maybe gonna take a few notes, if that's O.K.?  O.K. .. I'd like you to tell me in what ever way you want, what you can remember about the time you spent with Amber on the aft- ernoon she left? Take your time, and nothing's too trivial, O.K.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Well, I think I told you on the phone .. I went up to her room to say good-bye, and we just sat on the bed and chatted a while, while her friend was coming in and out collecting her things ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What kind of friend? Was he a boy friend? An old friend? New friend?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You must have some idea about him.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: When we spoke on the phone, did you know I was blonde?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Why not? You heard my voice?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: John? .. You never said that on the phone? .. What makes you think his name was John?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I don't know. I guess she must have called him John? I'm mak- ing tea. Would you like some?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: The elevator wasn't working?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: No, it has a mind of its own.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Can I see your hands?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: My hands?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Is there anything else you can tell me? Anything about him or her? Doesn't matter how small?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: No. Except he smoked. Like you.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Me?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Yes, I could smell it on his breath, like I can on your's.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: D'you have a dog? Seeing Eye Dog?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Lotta scratch-marks on your door?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Sometimes I look after friends dogs, if they go to dances, or something?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Did Amber have a dog?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What color was it?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Have you been here long?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No, just a minute or two .. I knocked on your door - no one home, so I followed the music ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm sorry. I'll get my things.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No problem. I'm not in a hurry.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I suppose I'm the worst witness you've ever had?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I gotta admit, you're one of them. Just wish I knew what you meant by a "hollow car?"

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Well, some cars sound fat and some cars sound thin, and this kind of car sounded "hollow" ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: If I came to the diner with you, would you bring me back?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Of course I would ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I'm sorry, someone slammed the door on me. I couldn't get out.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: It was probably the wind.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: What are you reading?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Hamlet. Have you read it?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You should. It's wonderful.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Are you wearing a uniform?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Oh.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Well, I'm glad we got the conver- sational side of lunch over with.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I'm sorry .. I don't like sitting in the middle of a restaurant .. I feel like everyone's looking at me ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: There's no one "looking at you" .. There's hardly anyone in here. The only person looking at you, is me.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Are you married?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Was. But I don't like to talk about it.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You just asked me to ask you questions.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I know, but you pick on the one time in my life I like not to remember. I was in the bad lands. Really not well. It's something that happens to a lota cops. We don't wanna talk about that.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: "Thoughts that lie too deep for tears."

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Yeah, that'll do .. Is that "Hamlet?"

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: No, Wordsworth .. Do you like poetry?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I don't know, I haven't read much. I don't think poetry's my kinda thing?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Do you pray?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Pray?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: You said, you were in the bad lands?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: No, I don't pray .. Had a dream once, about God, just around the time I was getting well .. He was a nasty lookin little guy, moved into the apartment right on topa me .. I said, don't you listen to people's prayers?  He said, prayers? Not often. They're Junk Mail.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Sorry?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: .. sorry your father, mother sis- ter, whatever .. I couldn't take another day of it .. Come on, I'm gonna rob you of a cup of coffee ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: She runs a kind of hair dress- ing and you know, beauty salon ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Have you known her long?

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I was married to her sister ..

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I know what you're like ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: How d'you know what I'm like?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Ross told me.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Really? What did he say?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: He said you're quite chubby. And you have a nervous tick.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: He said that? What else did he say?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Just your age.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Which is what?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Fifty-seven .. I don't mind ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: I have to talk to you, Helena.

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I know.

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: You know? How do you know?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: Coz you hardly said a word since you got here. But you been thinking pretty loud ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Has he got your aunt's address?

turns.speaker: HELENA
turns.text: I don't think so .. He said the police had been calling .. want- ed to ask me some more questions ..

turns.speaker: BERLIN
turns.text: Who?  Probably Angelo .. I'll take care of it .. Don't worry, we- 're gonna find this guy, and everything'll be O.K. .. O.K.?
